query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.title: EMP-E Conference - 'Modelling Clean Energy Pathways'
result.description:
The Energy Modelling Platform for Europe (EMP-E) culminates in a yearly conference, bringing together scientists and policy makers to discuss cutting edge energy modelling issues. Stakeholders are provided with a peer-reviewed digest of model and policy insights for European energy scenario. The platform serves as a continuous forum for exchanging research, development and practice of energy system modelling in Europe and, where feasible, promote the sharing of data and resources. It thus shall increase the efficiency, integrity and access to European energy modelling data, scenarios, tools and results.
The agenda of this years meeting of the Energy Modelling Platform includes three plenary sessions with key themes to be highlighted being modelling of behavioural aspects, integrated modelling of energy and resource efficiency as well as innovation in the energy transition. Thanks to the active involvement of EC representatives and leading researchers, we can ensure to bridge the gap between modelling and policy making at European, regional and local level.

project.title: Navigating the Roadmap for Clean, Secure and Efficient Energy Innovation

result.title: Package of six Neighbourhood Mobility Action Plans
result.description: WP2 culminates in six Neighbourhood Mobility Action Plans; these are concrete implementation plans articulating responsibilities, budgets, timescales etc. and they will then be implemented throughout WP3. D2.4 is a package of six such Neighbourhood Mobility Action Plans.

result.title: An evaluation report on the success of the open field days and seminars 1
result.description: During rice season, IRTA will organize open field days to present the new rice varieties tolerant to salinity conditions and the new salinity sensor to rice farmers and rice technicians. Out of rice season, in winter, seminars will be organized in order to present the results of the trials to rice stakeholder. Those open days are a referent for the rice sector in Spain, and many farmers from the different rice area in Spain attend them in order to keep abreast the innovation on rice crop.

project.title: New commercial EUropean RICE (Oryza sativa) harbouring salt tolerance alleles to protect the rice sector against climate change and apple snail (Pomacea insularum) invasion

result.title: Co-Implementation Guidelines
result.description: WP3 will start with an intensive workshop for the Neighbourhood Coordinators of each action neighbourhood in Jerusalem (attached to consortium meeting in project month 8) where the WP3 leader will assist the participants in the conceptual preparation of their implementation phase. Soon afterwards, the WP3 leader will start a travel tour to each action neighbourhood in order to kick-start the local implementation process on the ground (between month 12 and 19). In preparation of these workshops, Co-Implementation Guidelines (D3.1) will be prepared and fed into the Neighbourhood Mobility Pathfinder.

result.title: Report on definitions of the circular economy and associated markets
result.description: The deliverable will be a report (about 10-15 pages) summarising existing circular economy definitions and providing a mapping of circular economy sectors and markets. The report will also discuss the markets and economic sectors that will be assessed in this project. This will be a guiding document for the accomplishment of the empirical work in the other WPs.

result.title: Three Infographics
result.description: In order to address all relevant public, including stakeholders, policy makers and advisors, but also the general public, infographics will be created. result.title: Project Newsletters
result.description: Starting in M9 and every six months thereafter (M9, 15, 21, 27, 33, 39 and 45), the project will publish and distribute a Newsletter with the view to inform the widest possible public and stakeholders, as well as similar CIVITAS project participants on all project development aspects, future events and activities at local, national and European levels in the areas of sustainable transport and sustainable tourism.

result.title: Data collection report on the impacts of biofuels and renewable energy (M16)
result.description: Currently the biofuel sector and the renewable energy sector are the most important sectors in the transition to a circular economy. result.title: Workshop paper for case study 3
result.description: Each case study will start with interviews with the important experts followed by desk research and the development of an impact paper describing the macroeconomic impacts of the process or processes involved, the obstacles and potentials of mainstreaming that process and the macroeconomic and societal impacts of such a mainstreaming. The first draft of that report will be shared and discussed in a short expert meeting (workshop) with industry experts to validate results and get further input.

result.title: Synthesis Policy Brief
result.description: This short (around 5 pages) Synthesis Policy Brief will summarise with easy-to-understand language the main results of the project and the implications for the European Semester. It will take an integrative approach across WPs 2-5, developing a storyline of CIRCULAR IMPACTs outcomes and results.

result.title: Proceedings of the Final Conference in Brussels
result.description: A Final Conference will take place during the last month of the project. This half-day Conference will present to the public the collected knowledge, policy implications and recommendations of the project as well as present the added value of the project for the European Semester.
